intro: Stenopetalum trisectum, commonly known as the three-lobed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with three distinct petals. Its leaves are deeply lobed, giving it the species name "trisectum," which refers to the three divisions of the leaf blade. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
